entries.meaning: The plant, a vine of genus Vitis, on which grapes grow.
examples: Although many grape vines have geographical names, those rarely reflect their real origin, if known at all.

entries.meaning: An informal person-to-person means of circulating information or gossip.
examples: Synonyms: jungle drums, bush telegraph, jungle telegraph, mulga wire, rumor mill
I heard through the grapevine that Jim will be leaving soon.

entries.meaning: (skating) A move in which the feet are alternately placed in front of each other, while both remaining on the ice or ground, incorporating half-turns.

verbs.description: grapevine (third-person singular simple present grapevines, present participle grapevining, simple past and past participle grapevined)

entries.meaning: (transitive, wrestling) To restrain in a leglock.
